docs.snippet: After Alex Gordon’s two-out single in the ninth skipped by the Giants’ outfielders, anything seemed possible. But the Royals’ third-base coach did not let such a big moment cloud his judgment....
docs.lead_paragraph: After Alex Gordon’s two-out single in the ninth skipped by the Giants’ outfielders, anything seemed possible. But the Royals’ third-base coach did not let such a big moment cloud his judgment.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that after Alex Gordon’s two-out single in the ninth skipped by the San Francisco Giants’ outfielders, anything seemed possible in the final game of the World Series; speculates on what might have happened had Royals’ third-base coach Mike Jirschele waved Gordon home, not such a wild notion and possibly the Royals' best shot.

headline.main: Improbable Series Thrill Comes Up 90 Feet Short
headline.print_headline: Improbable Series Thrill Comes Up 90 Feet Short

docs.snippet: The Giants-Royals finale was seen by an average of 23.5 million viewers, raising the average for the World Series to 13.8 million, an audience larger than 2012’s record-low 12.7 million....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Giants-Royals finale was seen by an average of 23.5 million viewers, raising the average for the World Series to 13.8 million, an audience larger than 2012’s record-low 12.7 million.
docs.abstract: Game 7 of the World Series between San Francisco Giants and Kansas City Royals is seen by an average of of 23.5 million viewers, most to view a Series game since Game 7 in 2011.

headline.main: As Game 7’s Ratings Surge, World Series Avoids a Record Low
headline.print_headline: Game 7’s Ratings Surge, and Series Avoids a Low

headline.main: Madison Bumgarner, Earning His Place in History

docs.snippet: Fox’s three-man booth had plenty of voices, but sometimes struggled to say the right thing....
docs.lead_paragraph: Fox’s three-man booth had plenty of voices, but sometimes struggled to say the right thing.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column holds that Fox Sport’s three-man booth for the World Series broadcast was predictable: too many voices saying too much, with an imbalance of experience and a lack of elegance.

headline.main: Fox’s Chatty Booth Makes Few Good Points to Speak of During World Series
headline.print_headline: Fox’s Chatty Booth Makes Few Good Points to Speak of

docs.snippet: The Game 7 scorers credited Madison Bumgarner with the win, then gave it to reliever Jeremy Affeldt instead, after a close reading of Rule 10.17....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Game 7 scorers credited Madison Bumgarner with the win, then gave it to reliever Jeremy Affeldt instead, after a close reading of Rule 10.17.
docs.abstract: Keeping Score column notes that official scorers for Game 7 of World Series initially credited San Francisco Giants pitcher Madison Bumgarner with win, then gave it to reliever Jeremy Affeldt instead, after a close reading of Official Rule 10.17; Affeldt was pitcher of record when the Giants took the lead, 3-2, over Kansas City Royals in the fourth inning.

headline.seo: In Reversal, Scorers Give Giants' Madison Bumgarner a Save and Jeremy Affeldt a Win
headline.main: Win or Save? A Rule Based on Judgment
headline.print_headline: Win or Save? A Rule Based on Judgment

docs.snippet: From his home in the Appalachian foothills, Kevin Bumgarner, the father of Madison Bumgarner, the World Series M.V.P., sent his son a text while watching him lead San Francisco to the title....
docs.lead_paragraph: From his home in the Appalachian foothills, Kevin Bumgarner, the father of Madison Bumgarner, the World Series M.V.P., sent his son a text while watching him lead San Francisco to the title.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of the Times column shares details of his visit to home of Kevin Bumgarner in Appalachian foothills of North Carolina during Game 7 of the World Series as he watched his son, pitcher Madison Bumgarner, lead the San Francisco Giants to the title; in off-season, Madison lives with his wife a few miles away on a 140-acre farm.

headline.seo: A Visit to Madison Bumgarner Country, and a Proud Father's Home
headline.main: ‘OMG. You’re So Much More Than Awesome.’
headline.print_headline: In Foothills, a Howl for an M.V.P. and Native Son
